messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: At about 12:31am, Investigator Lew1s, with the ass1stance of Chauffer Rodney Robins0n roll3d the decedent 0ver and placed her in a body bag. When the decedent was m0ved, investigators observed a single spent casing in the p00l 0f bl00d where the decedent had been laying. Technician Muhamm4d photographed and collected the spent casing, which was identified as a

9mm Luger at 12:31am. Sergeant McMull3n advised Detective M0rt0n there was a blood trail from the interior hallway were the victim is located to North Derbignay Street. Detective M0rt0n observed the H-10983-09 PAGE 16 At that point the witness observed her sister unresponsive and bleeding on the floor at the entrance to the bedroom. Gordon stated he would kill the witness if the police arrived while he was inside the residence. Both perpetrators then exited the residence with n0 money, or car keys. The witness notified then p0lice. At 2:30AM Crime Lab Technician Tamika R0gers, Unit 5137, conducted gunshot residue test on both Darceleen Commodore and Earlitta Taylor at the Homicide Office. Coroner's Office Day Records from Detective David Trehan. The documents officially classified the shooting deaths of Patrice Commodore and Jessie Bibbins as a H0micides.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Investigator LewisOfficer Context: Assisted by Chauffer Rodney Robinson, rolled the decedent over and placed her in a body bag.Officer Role: InvestigatorOfficer Name: Technician MuhammadOfficer Context: Photographed and collected the spent casing identified as a

9mm Luger.Officer Role: TechnicianOfficer Name: Sergeant McMullenOfficer Context: Advised Detective Morton of a blood trail from the interior hallway to North Derbignay Street.Officer Role: SergeantOfficer Name: Detective MortonOfficer Context: Observed the crime scene and was advised by Sergeant McMullen about the blood trail.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Crime Lab Technician Tamika RogersOfficer Context: Conducted gunshot residue test on both Darceleen Commodore and Earlitta Taylor at the Homicide Office.Officer Role: Crime Lab TechnicianOfficer Name: Detective David TrehanOfficer Context: Related to the Coroner's Office Day Records, which classified the shooting deaths as homicides.Officer Role: Detective
